item.title: SQL Window Functions Explained
item.description: Window functions are probably the most confusing section of SQL. You might think, “So what? They just came up with some additional functions”. Not really. “Window functions” is a separate language built into regular SQL. And it’s more complicated than everything you know about SELECTs. In short, window functions assist in making great analytical reports without Excel. Maybe you want to calculate monthly sales percentages over the year? Window functions. Split marketing channels into effective and ineffective ones?

item.title: Idempotent Close in Go
item.description: Idempotence is when a repeated call to an operation on an object does not result in changes or errors. Idempotence is a handy development tool. item.title: Expressive Ellipsis in Python
item.description: One of the lesser-known things in Python is the ellipsis: class Flyer: def fly(self): ... This code works. The ... (aka Ellipsis)Â is a real object that can be used in code. Ellipsis is the only instance of the EllipsisType type (similar to how None is the only instance of the NoneType type): >>> ... is Ellipsis >>> True >>> Ellipsis is ... >>> True Python core devs mostly use .
